Disabled Apps only ADB only Apps and ADB Buttons Home button Menu button Short press action Long press action Double tap action No action Open/close menu Recent apps switcher Search assistant Voice search In-app search Launch camera Turn screen off App security Blacklist Edit blacklist entry Settings Delete You don\'t have any blacklisted numbers. Add an entry by touching the Add (+) button. To blacklist calls and/or messages from certain numbers, enable the blacklist. Disabled Incoming calls and messages from phone numbers in the blacklist will be blocked Show notification Private numbers Don\'t block calls from private numbers Block incoming %2$s from private numbers Unknown numbers Don\'t block calls or messages from numbers not in the contact list Block incoming %2$s from numbers not in the contact list calls messages calls and messages Use wildcards Use . as a wildcard and * for repetition. E.g. 123.* blocks numbers starting with 123 and .*123.* blocks numbers containing 123 Block incoming calls Block incoming messages Unable to add invalid number to blacklist Add number Remove number Do you want to remove this blacklist entry? Select contact App security SMS message limit Display an alert dialog to prevent applications from sending SMS messages too frequently. Current limit: %d messages in 15 minutes 30 (Default) Added %1$s Last blocked %1$s Filter notifications No filters set Denied %s Equalizer Interface Lock screen Navigation Performance Status bar Notifications Network traffic Status bar traffic monitor Enable various network traffic options in statusbar Display unit Update interval Disabled Outgoing Incoming Outgoing and incoming Bits per second Bytes per second 500 ms 1000 ms 1500 ms 2000 ms Auto hide Hide the traffic monitor when there is no activity Inactivity threshold Rotation Disabled degrees Rotation modes 0 degrees 90 degrees 180 degrees 270 degrees LiquidSmooth sound Safe headset volume Prevent loud volume levels when headset is first plugged in Listening at high volume for long periods may damage your hearing. Disable it with caution. Notifications Less frequent notification sounds Limit the notification sounds of each app to only play once per set time period Default Behaviour 3 seconds 5 seconds 10 seconds 15 seconds 30 seconds 45 seconds 1 minute 2 minutes 5 minutes Media control Volume keys control media volume rather than notifications LAN Settings Device hostname Wakeup options Volume rocker wake Pressing the volume rocker up/down will wake the device Wake up on charge Wake up device if charger is plugged/unplugged. Advanced options Disable fullscreen keyboard Landscape keyboard will never take up entire screen Volume key cursor control Volume up/down moves cursor left/right Volume up/down moves cursor right/left Auto keyboard rotation Force auto-rotate when keyboard is shown Auto-rotate timeout Disables auto-rotate sensor %1$s seconds after keyboard is hidden This feature forces auto-rotate to turn on temporarily while the keyboard is shown. It has no effect when auto-rotate is already enabled. Show enter key Force keyboard to show enter instead of emoticon key Selector notification Display input method selector notification Status bar Style General Advanced settings Enable more settings options Double-tap to wake Privacy LiquidSmooth Enable Privacy Guard Enable Privacy Guard? When Privacy Guard is enabled, the app will not be able to access personal data such as contacts, messages or call logs. When enabling Privacy Guard for a built-in app, the app will not be able to access or provide personal data. This may cause other apps to misbehave. Enabled by default Enable by default for newly-installed apps Privacy Guard Manage which apps have access to your personal data No apps are installed Help Reset Reset permissions? In this screen you can choose which apps Privacy Guard should be active for by simply tapping on them. Selected apps will not be able to access your personal data such as contacts, messages or call logs. Long pressing an app\'s entry opens its app details screen.\n\nBuilt-in apps are not shown by default but can be revealed by selecting the respective menu option. Show built-in apps Advanced Increasing ring volume Start volume Ramp-up time Advanced reboot Include options in the power menu for rebooting into recovery and bootloader Advanced reboot menu Disable Hide on lock screen Show always USB debugging notify Display a notification when USB debugging is connected Kill app back button Kill the foreground app by long-pressing the back button Enable on-screen nav bar Enable on-screen navigation bar and disable hardware buttons <<<<<<< HEAD Device Configure device specific options ======= Accept all file types SMS message limit Display an alert dialog to prevent applications from sending SMS messages too frequently. Current limit: %d messages in 15 minutes 50 (Default) Custom density Custom Set custom density Set "INVALID DENSITY!" "Current density: " DPI Battery saver sec LTE (recommended) 4G (recommended) 3G Only 2G/3G Auto 2G/3G Preferred 2G Only 1x Global Undefined Battery saver Battery saver This will automatically manage your device battery usage and switch your network to user-defined power saving mode or normal mode depending on mobile data and Wi-Fi connection states This will automatically manage your device battery usage to user-defined Normal network mode Power saving network mode When screen turns off Activate power saving mode when screen turns off Ignore while locked When screen turns on, power saving mode won\'t be deactivated until keyguard is unlocked Change mode delay Delays changing of power saving mode When battery low Activate power saving mode when battery low Battery level Activate power saving mode or changing screen brightness by specified battery level Disable bluetooth Disable bluetooth connection when power saving activated Disable mobile data Disable mobile data connection when power saving activated Disable gps Disable gps connection when power saving activated Disable Wi-Fi Disable Wi-Fi connection when power saving activated Disable LED Disable LED notification when power saving activated Disable vibrate Disable vibration when power saving activated Brightness mode Activates brightness level change when battery low Brightness level Changing brightness level when power saver activated CPU power saving mode This will automatically switch your maximum cpu frequency to user-defined power saving mode Current Speed Maximum speed: Core Status Core Limits Offline Core Activate CPU power saving mode Attention: we never can guarantee this will work on device Smart network change Allow changing network to normal mode with specific interval time after screen turn off and power saving mode enabled Smart network signal Activate power saving mode when no network signal after 5 minutes Disable sync Disable sync connection when power saving activated Kill all task Allow to kill all task when power saving activated Show toast Allow to showing toast message when battery saver changing device configuration Battery options Radio options Other Network options GSM Networks CDMA Networks System options Development shortcut Enable \'wipe data\' and \'force close\' options in notification area and recent apps list Warning ART is not supported by LiquidSmooth. This setting is included for experimentation only and has the potential to cause instability, crashes, data loss or prevent the proper boot of your device. Visit Introducing ART for more information.

We request you do not file bug reports if you have enabled ART as your runtime.

Are you sure you want to reboot to change runtime from %1$s to %2$s? Gesture has been set Confirm your gesture Draw your gesture Gesture Low security, experimental Gesture Disable FC Notifications This will hide all force close notifications Enable Halo Configure or view current halo settings When checked the bubble is activated Hide after activity Appears then scrolls out of the way Reverse gestures Drag using double tap swipe gestures Current policy Black or white listing notifications Blacklist Whitelist Pause active app Open while the underlying app pauses Ninja mode Will vanish completely when empty Enable message pop-up Show message box for incoming Ping on unlock Ping bubble when device is unlocked Halo size How big the bubble is going to be Miniscule Small Normal (default) Large Gigantic Monster Notification count Display current notification counts None Total Per app Both Message box animation Message box animations for incoming None Flip Blacklist from Halo Whitelist from Halo Circle color Define the background shading color Quick ribbon Show in drawer Linked layout Use the select tiles from quick settings Ribbon and layout View, select or change the ribbon widgets Vibrate on touch Vibrate when touching tiles App circle sidebar Display circular app sidebar launcher Enable circular app sidebar launcher Included apps Apps that show in app circle sidebar Trigger width Adjust the width of trigger area Trigger position Adjust the position of trigger area Trigger height Adjust the height of trigger area Warning Proceed with Caution Prop modder Switches build.prop mods (reboot required) These settings are included for experimentation and any changes made to them have the potential to cause instability, crashes, data loss or hardware failures.\n\nWe request you do not file bug reports if any of these settings have been changed from the defaults. Mods involving startup scripts Disable bootanimation Wifi scan interval The time between wifi scans when no stored access points are available Time between wifi scans: %s Windows Manager\'s max events per second This is a runtime value that controls the number of events the system will allow in a second Max number of system events: %s Telephone ringer delay The amount of time from when the system registers an incoming phone call until the ringer Incoming call Delay: %s Dalvik cache heapsize This controls the size of the cache the Dalvik VM has access to Dalvik VM cache size: %s Show The Build.Prop Find out whats in there Displaying /system/Build.Prop Loading build.prop\u2026 Error loading build.prop\u2026 Unknown Version We should look because knowing is half the battle HSUPA upload speed hack *WARNING* if you change this value it will add the needed values to your build.prop if they are not already present Fast up found active: %s Proximity sensor delay When you are in-call screen is off when the device moves away from your face this delay value controls how long before screen turns on Proximity sensor set to: %s Change your Build Number This is astetic and doesn\'t improve the system Build Number: %s PM Sleep mode Modify Nighttime sleep policy Current Sleep Mode: %s Just In Time Complier Enables/Disables JIT complier Optimize TCP Stack Modify the buffer-size for better performance 3G Speed Hack Uncap 3g speed GPU Acceleration Enable hardware acceleration where the GPU controls the UI instead of the CPU Startup tweaks Zipalign apps Zipalign any unaligned apps on each boot Fix permissions Fix permissions on apps and data on each boot Enable sysctl Enable sysctl tweaks at boot Free memory Set minfree values at boot Clear cache Clear application cache files each boot Enable scheduled tasks Enable scheduled cron jobs Enable SD boost Enable/disable SD card speed boost File system speedup Speed up file systems at boot Foreground app mem Visible app mem Expanded desktop style Disabled Status bar visible Status bar hidden Blacklist Blacklist from Floating Mode Blacklist from Halo Blacklist from Hover Blacklist from Peek Hover settings Enables and customize hover notifications Hide button Hide the hover button in status bar Activate Hover Use hover and hide status bar button Exclude low priority Notifications marked as low priority Exclude non-clearable Notifications marked as non clearable Require expanded desktop Only show when status bar is hidden Exclude topmost app Exclude from the foreground app Hover notification time 3 seconds 5 seconds (default) 7 seconds 10 seconds 15 seconds Extra information Display extra info for cpu, display, etc Ring mode Normal Vibrate Mute Profiles Add Delete Profile To configure and use system profiles, turn profiles on. Configure trigger Triggers All triggers Wi-Fi triggers Bluetooth triggers Write to NFC tag Touch tag to write Tag successfully written Tag writing failed! Profile selected: %1$s Writing a profile to a NFC tag allows for tapping the tag to select the profile. Tapping a second time will select the previously selected profile. Unknown profile This NFC tag refers to an unknown profile. Attaching this NFC tag to an existing profile will allow for selecting the profile in the future. Select profile Create new profile Name Enter a name for the new profile New profile Rename Enter a new name Duplicate profile name! Duplicate app group name! Reset Delete all user created profiles and app groups and restore them to default? Delete this profile? Remove this app?
